title: Honestly: People want Riot to cover for their bad decisions/play too much
body:
The whining I've seen on the game play boards recently just throws me for a loop. It's like people don't even know what game they're playing these days. Or rather, they know what the game is and they'd rather be playing "League of *insert summoner name here*" instead.

**League is part dynamic gameplay, yes, but it's PART STRATEGIC.** No one seems to give two flips about the latter half of the game, though. Yes, that means team comps *always* matter. Yes, that means if you pick the only tank in your comp and go full ad, you're a moron. No, the game shouldn't have to be bent and twisted to compensate for your pre-game or in-game stupidity in this regard. If you have an abundance of split pushers, no one's gonna hold objectives for you to split. If you have an abundance of utility champs, you put extreme emphasis on your few damage dealers. If you have a crap ton of assassins, know that you don't have utility and you invested a shit ton into the early game. If you intentionally disregard certain elements of the game, you can't just up and complain about it when you get rolled by those elements in the game. The issue is that people act like this game's balanced like a fighting game. That's *part* of it, yeah, but not all of it. You're gonna have bad match-ups, you're gonna have to worry about who's who and who's doing what, and no, you can't do everything yourself, nor is it a smart idea to balance a team game so that you consistently can.

**How many times are we gonna whine about meta/champs?** And I don't mean the *usual* whining. I mean the whining that caused the assassin update. THAT whining. If it isn't a tank meta, everyone wants it to be a tank meta. If it IS a tank meta, everyone complains about fighters being bad. When assassins are one-shotting targets, everyone wants Riot to add counter-play to "no counter-play, face-roll assassins". When they add that to those champs, now we're bitching about adcs not being killed. When Riot's doing champ updates in bulk, everyone complains about how they hate class updates. When class updates are officially dropped, people start talking about wanting that "Diver update" that was in the pipeline. 

Now, we could go on with this for a LONG time, but the point is: Regardless of if these things were good or bad things to complain about, are you guys upset because they're *actually issues* or because *you just don't like X and you want something to happen?* Perfect example being game length. In season 5, no...not every champ was good. Every LATE GAME CHAMP was good. Early game bullies had it rough as hell in season 5 during Cinderhulk's early months and team comps could have up to 3 tanks at a time, with comps *regularly* having at least 2 tanks. Games would go on for 40+ minutes almost consistently, and Jinx/Vayne were CONSTANTLY complained about, which led Riot to eventually nerf the absolute crap out of Jinx (to the point where she's kinda shit, tbh). And now we got *thread after thread* begging Riot to force game lengths to be *longer* than now. Why? Makes no sense. We have a solid mix of early and late game champs being strong picks *right now.* Why would we fuck that over? It makes even LESS sense when people *also* want hyper carries like Twitch to be nerfed *at the same time.* HELLO? These two complaints don't even add up together.

**The circle jerk is probably the worst offender.** The Yasuo and Fiora jerks are probably the worst of them all, but seriously, these circle jerks are just too damn much. Like...let's take Twitch's circle jerk, for example. If I go to LeagueofGraphs, Twitch has about a 51.6% win rate atm (for Diamond, anyway). Now, a Rioter specifically commented on Twitch (forget which) and said "Rain or shine, Twitch usually sits on about a 'pretty solid' win rate because his kit allows him to exploit elements that thrive in solo queue more than organized play". Makes sense if you think on it. When Censer was strong, Twitch had about a 52% win rate. Censer's not strong? Still around 52%. Some champs just abuse solo queue, and Twitch most likely is that type of guy. Hell, the highest win rate solo queue marksman isn't even Twitch according to this site. It's *fucking Draven* at almost 55% after the Censer nerfs brought down all the hyper carries. So why the hell is everyone and their G-ma on Twitch for basically existing in stasis? Should Twitch just get Sejuani'd? Is that how balancing should be? Champs should just "take turns being good"? Is that the answer we're looking for?

My issue isn't necessarily having a complaint. That's fine. My issue stems from complaints that look like people just want Riot to fix the game to cater to them specifically rather than looking at why something may be the way it is.

replies.body:
Your entire post is based on the idea of the League of Legends community being one hive mind.

It isn't, that's why there's always going to be conflict of interests and complaining. 

It's not that they don't see why something exists. They do, it just doesn't benefit them, so they complain.

The battle of interests and appealing to said interests creates the rotating metas. It's basically like politics.

Here's the thing: Sometimes it IS.

It's literally the primary reason we reworked assassins, as well as what caused the Skarner debacle during the juggernaut patch. It also canned Dynamic Queue and caused that major turn-around from "ADC in 2017" to "ADC ripping a fat bullet in my ass in 2017".

There's *some* instances where the community *collectively* causes a swing or two in how things are done in the game when Riot caters to the uproar. This post attempts to focus on those, although it also attempts to call out those generally whiny posts I see on here.

And, in the very few times when the community decides to agree, that shows generally there's a problem in whatever topic is being discussed.

Assassins were generally agreed by everyone to be problematic in one way or another for a long time.
Almost everyone hated Dynamic Queue
I'm not sure about the ADC one, so I won't talk about it. 

In those few cases, Riot should cater to the community. 

This season, for instance; how long have people complained about runes? Riot is finally addressing them, and their absurd IP cost points of entry. Everyone hated runes, Riot listened, and they're right to do so.

Some of those posts were probably whiny, but are you saying that, when the League community finally agrees on something, Riot should ignore them?

Depends

In the case of assassins, listening to the community just royally nerfed assassins. Now we're all whining about marksmen going around unpunished, but the assassin rework was the first instance of Riot dislodging the burst > tank > sustain relationship by adding delays to assassin burst. Yeah, people appreciate them as opponents (a bit) more, but playing AS them is significantly less rewarding.

Riot doesn't ALWAYS make the right choice by listening to the community if the community itself is making the wrong choice, which we have a few examples of at this point.

Heres the assassins are weak circlejerk in action, ladies and gentlemen. Im going to go dumpster an immobile mage with Katarina/Zed/Leblanc/Fizz now.

Assassins are more fair then ever now. I think "Oh man, that guy is good. I misplayed that" when I die to them now. I dont think "Man, leblanc is bs" when im killed. The problem is, assassins are actually hard to play now. They are all skill expressive in their kits rather then waiting for key abilities to be used. You want tank ekko and fizz back? Those where only killed because riot succeeded in adding delay to them. They added a delay to ekko passive and fizz's mark, and that succeeded in removing the "toxic" playstyles.

I will NEVER miss being oneshot from stealth by rengar. NEVER.

Reworking assassins was the BEST thing riot ever did. Katarina is so much more fun then she used to be, and highly rewards skill with her kit. She has actual skill expression now, instead of just waiting. Leblanc is still as good as ever, while remaining fair. Sure you can flash her damage as shes waiting for the delay, but thats what makes her fair. If she gets the sigil proc off, it HURTS. Talon now fills a niche and feels GOOD to play, and is much more memorable then the guy that popped into vision for 2 seconds before oneshotting your entire team. Rengar... ill admit he got the short end of the stick, but change the Q and hes back to being a good and satisfying champion. His new ult and necklace are steps in the right direction, but the Q is what made his rework bad.

You want a bad class rework, go look at what happened to Quinn. Yet no one misses her, its all "MAH ASSASSINS"
Ya know, I feel where youâ€™re coming from about Quinn, but not gonna lie: I actually prefer new Quinn, lol.

Rengar could be spotted out had an indicator and had to combo so it wasnt a one shot you just and to stick close to some one with cc as a squishy  but wait all the tanks cc is now delayed and does no damage so there is no one to cc to save you any more. What was more bs was instant katarina e ult which she still has she just has ways to do more damage on top of that and get back out now. zed insta combo after ult which he can still do before you can react sure you may able to stun him after he has done enough damage so that his ult is sure to kill and maybe you kill him after but he still got his target though its not likely for you to get him. 
Assassins should have either get in or get out skills not both and all skills with longer. cooldowns and less base damage and more scaling damage  enough to kill adcs and mages but not duel it out with fighters and tanks. either was still better than adcs doing the same thing from range at least assassins had delay on their second round on spells before when they were strong but didnt snowball adcs dont have that delay unless is versus another adc (not that it exists just that you either are the dominant adc or you arent in an adc versus adc fight and you just the most dominant champion otherwise)

People had differing opinions on whether assasins were OP or not.

What people agreed on were that a large majority of assassins were innately toxic, because of their oneshots. Pre-rework Rengar or Talon (esp. Rengar), or LB's early just being cancerous for everyone.

Listening to the community led to Riot extending the burst windows of assassins to make the game healthier, and they buffed their dmg to accomodate for this. Some of the reworks were failures yes, but that applies to all class updates.

Assassins fell off not so much because of direct nerfs, but because of more focus on teamfights and more shielding/healing being buffed. Tanks rising to dominance in top/jg doesn't help with that either.

Most people felt that it wasn't right for assassins to be killing tanks, as tanks were supposed to be a "counter class." 

It's more rewarding for people playing against assassins, but it's also good for slightly less people to be complaining about assassins.  The other improvements to assassins were Riot giving them more variable itemization and uniqueness through reworks. They tried to make a way for assassins to kill adcs easily but not be so effective vs tanks.

While I would say the assassin rework wasn't as good as it could've been, it wasn't horrible. Just kinda average.

What other examples are there of the entire community being wrong?

The jugs patch is the first primary example that comes to my mind. Whole community complained about most of the jugs feeling too weak on PBE. They came to live and just rolled *everyone.* I was a Silver to Gold player at the time, but all my draft picks had each jug banned *every* game unless one was picked until it all got ironed out.

Community: Juggs too weak

Riot: Overbuffs

Community: Juggs too strong

Riot: Nerfs

Community: Juggs are fine now

Riot: Good

The community wasn't wrong in this case; Juggs were weak, and so they got buffed. The buffs may have been a little over-the-top for some of them, but it eventually got ironed out. 

The community would be wrong if they said Juggs were weak when they actually weren't, but the Juggs were actually weak. They only became too strong because of buffs, reworks, and itemization changes, not because they were powerful before Riot decided to rework them

Anyway I've occasionally gone on my own long specified posts to the subject or issue at hand; to sum up though, it's more that riot has been steadily reducing reasons to be interested over the years. 
Reworked champions either being negligible stat tweaks, or unrecognizable overhauls; the former often failing to fix the problem, and the later driving away mains without consideration. Removed items that had strange mixes of stats, while keeping some overtuned ones that keep bending balance; crippling flexibility in build paths and enforcing stale repetition. The previous time masteries was massively changed, it caused a make/break because a couple keystones were so much more powerful than others, limiting useful options and here we are putting up with it once again. Blatantly ignoring the pbe feedback when it doesn't entirely approve of their changes, frequently holding favoritism for some champions over others to an obnoxious degree; more recently lowering the standard of entry, allowing a flood of meta-maniacs and otherwise egotistical players to join, making the pbe environment hostile and troublesome to use now. Gutting some champions for being too good at a niche, while letting the generalists continue to bully out anyone who can't keep up. There's been a growing cluster of complaints about how towers are more valuable to the enemy than yourself, for the past three years, yet have been ignored time and again with marginal game-play nudges to say 'we are doing something about it'. Withholding the huge variety of gameplay modes under the excuse of 'not enough resources', then wondering why the game is loosing traction, and instead of undoing or reworking some of the previous changes that lead to this issue, they implement randomized rewards both in and out of game. Esports taking precedence over everything else, including common sense when it comes to quality of life regarding the overwhelming majority of the player base. Crunching the game that used to be about strategy, where early game and late game teams were both equally viable, into a state where early game decides everything; shifting the tense 45 minute neck & neck struggles, into 15 minute stomps. 
I could expand on any one of these, but I won't in this message as that'd triple the text, lol.

What is your point?

If "picking the right champion" (either an individual champion or a group of champions) increases your chance of winning, the premise of a game that says "play a champion out of 100+ options" does not hold true. Everybody prefers different types of champions because they fit most to his/ her playstyle.

So, yes, people complain about "meta" when the meta forces THEM to do something they don't want... and, they should have that right, because the game should be balanced enough so that all strategies make sense at all times (or, rather - and I agree with you here - that picking the right strategy counters the wrong strategy of the opposing team)... a constant struggle for Riot's balancing team that they will simply not be able to solve.

You know why? Because they balance based on data over a large sample size of games, and that large sample size ALREADY FOLLOWS the expected meta on average... the mere assumption that a champion should have a 50% win rate on average is leading to an UNBALANCED game, UNLESS that game also follows "the meta" (that was the basis for the 50% win rate) to the letter... so, "picking the right strategy" is not an option that you should ever think about, "picking the right champion within the current meta" is the only choice you need to make. Because that is the WAY the game is balanced in the first place (yes, you may be so great at the game that you can ignore the meta if you play at a level that is significantly below your actual skill, sure... but that doesn't change the fact for the average player).

And obviously, a lot of these problems are further made worse by what players think and assume: nobody knows whether maybe Soraka jungle is exceptional SOMETIMES (ok I am exaggerating...;)), nobody knows whether maybe playing with 2 junglers is a good idea SOMETIMES, nobody knows whether having 2 people mid instead of bot is a good idea SOMETIMES... because if you TRY EVEN ONCE, you tilt your team because they expect everybody to follow a very narrowly defined meta at all times.
 
Take the example of the Singed Support player with Smite... he EVEN GOT BANNED BY RIOT because he interfered too much with the expectations of other players on his team, ALTHOUGH he explained his strategy AND he had a positive win rate with it...
